title: How to Make an Upside Down Peach Tart

steps.headline: Cut the peaches into halves.
steps.description: Put them in a strainer over a bowl and allow the peaches to sit for about 30 minutes. This is to release the juices.

steps.headline: Place the peaches in a bowl and cover them with cinnamon and sugar.
steps.description: Toss lightly so the sugar and cinnamon won't get too absorbed.

steps.headline: Take out puff pastry dough and allow to soften.
Caramelize the peaches.
steps.description: Put 4 tablespoons of butter into a large skillet that can go in the oven. Heat the butter and slightly brown it. Add in the peaches with the skin side up. Arrange in a circle that is getting smaller. Allow to sit for 10-15 min. or until caramelized.

steps.headline: Lightly flour a surface and place the puff pastry dough on top.
With a floured rolling pin, roll out the dough to ⁄4 inch (6.4 mm) thick.
Once the dough is rolled out, place on top of the peaches that are in the skillet.
Put the tart in the oven and bake for 15 minutes or until the dough is lightly browned.
Flip the tart carefully upside down on a large, flat dish.
steps.description: Serve with peach or vanilla ice cream.

text: Cut the peaches into halves. Put them in a strainer over a bowl and allow the peaches to sit for about 30 minutes. This is to release the juices. Place the peaches in a bowl and cover them with cinnamon and sugar. Toss lightly so the sugar and cinnamon won't get too absorbed. Take out puff pastry dough and allow to soften.  Preheat the oven to 350 °F (177 °C).  Caramelize the peaches. Put 4 tablespoons of butter into a large skillet that can go in the oven. Heat the butter and slightly brown it. Add in the peaches with the skin side up. Arrange in a circle that is getting smaller. Allow to sit for 10-15 min. or until caramelized. Lightly flour a surface and place the puff pastry dough on top.  With a floured rolling pin, roll out the dough to ⁄4 inch (6.4 mm) thick.  Once the dough is rolled out, place on top of the peaches that are in the skillet. Pinch the sides. Put the tart in the oven and bake for 15 minutes or until the dough is lightly browned.  Allow the tart to cool.  Flip the tart carefully upside down on a large, flat dish. Serve with peach or vanilla ice cream.
